title: Summary of the Data
text:
I have tried three methods including ‘nearest’, ‘optimal’ and ‘full’ to run the propensity score matching. Among all three methods, the full optimal score matching shows a significant results in the later logistic regression analysis.
The following is the code for pre-processing and summary of the dataset.

library("MatchIt")
library("cobalt")    
library("ggplot2")   
library('dplyr')
library('lme4')
final_data <- read.csv('final.csv')
final_data$Gender <- as.factor(final_data$Gender)
final_data$Ethnicity <- as.factor(final_data$Ethnicity)
final_data$Econ_Index <- as.factor(final_data$Econ_Index)
final_data$tenure <- as.factor(final_data$tenure)  
final_data$Author.Position <- ordered(final_data$Author.Position, levels = c(0:4))
final_data$Journal_rank <- ordered(final_data$Journal_rank, levels = c(1:9))
final_data$Rank <- as.numeric(final_data$Rank)
final_data<- final_data[,-1]
summary(final_data)

title: Nearest
